newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Brown sees EU momentum on jobs.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Brown sees EU momentum on jobs.

text.p: Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown said on Tuesday he saw real momentum building up in the European Union to tackle unemployment and Britain would carry the process forward during its EU presidency in the first half of next year.
Brown issued a statement on the problem on the eve of flying to Luxembourg for talks with Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker, whose country has just embarked on its six-month EU presidency.

"There is now a genuine momentum building up to get Europe back to work," he said. "The back-to-back Presidencies of Luxembourg and the UK offer a real opportunity to push forward the new European jobs agenda."
Brown said Juncker's request, made on Monday, for member states to make suggestions for discussion at an informal meeting of EU finance ministers in September should kick-start the process.

Britain would look for real progress at an EU summit in November, he said, adding: "It will then fall to the British government to carry this important work forward." -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7767
